titles.title: Authorizing the 1996 Summer Olympic Torch Relay to be run through the Capitol Grounds, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Economic Development.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 104-608.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 236.

action.text: Mr. Gilchrest moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Amendment SP 4044 proposed by Senator Specter for Senator Ford.
Amendment SP 4044 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Gilchrest asked unanimous consent that the House agree to the Senate amendment.

vote.text: On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/11/1996--Passed Senate amended. Permits the 1996 Summer Olympic Torch Relay to be run through the Capitol Grounds as part of the ceremony of the Centennial Olympic Games to be held in Atlanta, Georgia.
